subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Major League Soccer will announce the bidders for two, and perhaps four, expansion teams after Wednesday’s 5 p.m. deadline. On Tuesday, a surprise bidder emerged — the Spanish club F.C. Barcelona, which entered into a strategic partnership with M.L.S. in April. On its Web site, Barcelona said it would field a team in the Miami area, where a previous club, the Miami Fusion, was folded by M.L.S. after the 2001 season.
